tickers.theme: Consumer AI + Services flywheel, Vision Pro ecosystem, silicon vertical integration.
metrics: Services revenue growth >12% y/y, attach rates for Vision Pro productivity bundles, Device install base (currently ~2.3B).
Gross margin trend (target maintaining 44%+), share of revenue from AI-enabled devices.
risks: China demand elasticity to premium pricing and regulatory pressure on iPhone usage.
Services regulation (app store fees, advertising disclosure) could compress high-margin segment.
Supply-chain concentration in advanced packaging partners (TSMC, ASE) for Apple Silicon.

tickers.theme: AI accelerators (MI300/MI325/MI350), x86 CPUs, adaptive computing.
metrics: AI GPU supply commitments, MI300 family market share (target double-digit exiting 2025).
Data center segment margin, software ecosystem adoption metrics.
risks: Execution risk on MI350 tape-out and supply vs demand alignment.
Pricing pressure if Nvidia or custom silicon leads to margin concessions.
Dependence on TSMC advanced nodes (5nm/4nm) for GPU production.

tickers.theme: AWS AI infrastructure, consumer AI, logistics flywheel.
metrics: AWS operating margin (>30%), capex (AI infrastructure) trends, retail operating income, ad revenue run-rate.
risks: AI competition from MSFT/GOOGL, customer multi-cloud strategies.
Regulatory scrutiny on marketplace practices and labor.
Margin compression if consumer spending slows.

tickers.theme: Lithography monopoly (EUV/High-NA), enabling sub-2nm semiconductor roadmap.
metrics: Backlog (>Â€35B), gross margin (>52%), service revenue growth, High-NA tools shipped vs planned (=10 in FY25).
risks: Export restrictions to China reducing DUV shipments.
Execution risk on High-NA installation schedules.
Macro capex slowdown if memory recovery stalls.

tickers.theme: Retail trading platform, options/crypto engagement, cash management expansion.
risks: Regulatory shifts in payment for order flow and crypto listing.
Customer concentration in high-beta traders increases revenue volatility.
Rate compression or deposit outflows reducing NII.

tickers.theme: GLP-1 obesity/diabetes leadership, pipeline breadth, consumer channel expansion.
metrics: GLP-1 script growth (>45% y/y), gross margin trajectory (>81%), R&D spend efficiency.
Supply chain cadence, international reimbursement wins.
risks: Competitive pressure from Novo Nordisk oral GLP-1 and biosimilars mid-term.
Manufacturing hiccups leading to supply constraints.
Pricing/reimbursement pressures as payers manage obesity spend.

tickers.theme: Consumer AI, social engagement, advertising, custom silicon.
metrics: Family of apps operating margin (>40%), Capex guidance (AI infrastructure), Reality Labs spend trajectory.
Daily active people (DAP), Reels monetization progress, AI assistant usage stats.
risks: Regulatory headwinds on data privacy, app store compliance.
Competition from TikTok, YouTube for user engagement.
Execution risk on hardware/silicon initiatives.

tickers.theme: Hyperscale AI, enterprise software, Copilot productivity, gaming/cloud ecosystem.
metrics: AI attach rates in Microsoft 365, Azure AI consumption, gross margin (cloud + AI capex efficiency), capital intensity trends.
risks: Capex digestion risk if corporate AI adoption slows.
Competitive pressure from AWS/GCP or in-house customer chips.
Regulatory constraints on AI/data usage.

tickers.theme: AI infrastructure backbone, accelerated computing, software ecosystem (CUDA + DGX Cloud).
metrics: Data center revenue mix (>78%), supply-demand balance (lead times trending 14-16 weeks), gross margin sustainability (>74%).
Networking revenue growth (Spectrum-X attach), software ARR disclosures.
risks: Export controls tightening on high-end GPUs to China/Middle East.
Competition from custom silicon (MSFT Maia, AMZN Trainium) could cap hyperscaler wallet share.
Supply chain disruptions in advanced packaging or HBM supply (SK Hynix, Samsung).

tickers.theme: Advanced nuclear microreactors, clean energy transition, DOE partnerships.
risks: Technology execution risk, regulatory delays, capital intensity.
Public perception/political shifts affecting nuclear policy.
Dilution risk from capital raises before commercialization.

tickers.theme: Mega-cap growth + AI platform aggregation (contains AAPL, MSFT, NVDA, AMZN, META, GOOG).
risks: Macroeconomic shocks (rates, recession) disproportionately impact high-duration equities.
Concentration risk (top 10 holdings >55% weight), regulatory scrutiny on big tech.
Crowd positioning leading to sharp de-risking in risk-off episodes.

tickers.theme: AI server design/mfg, liquid cooling, rapid configuration cycles.
metrics: Backlog visibility, inventory turns, gross margin trajectory (>17%).
Customer concentration and mix (hyperscaler vs enterprise).
risks: Supply constraints (HBM, GPUs) could delay deliveries.
Execution risk scaling manufacturing; quality control essential.
Competition from OEMs (Dell, HPE) responding aggressively.

tickers.theme: Broad U.S. equity exposure, S&P 500 benchmark, core asset allocation anchor.
risks: Re-acceleration of inflation forcing renewed tightening, compressing multiples.
Earnings deterioration from margin pressure or growth slowdown.
Geopolitical shocks or fiscal stress impacting risk sentiment.

tickers.theme: EV leadership, AI autonomous stack, energy storage scale-up.
metrics: Automotive gross margin ex-credits (>18%), FSD take rate (>25% of U.S. deliveries), energy storage deployments (>20 GWh annualized).
China weekly registrations, Cybertruck ramp efficiency, AI training compute spend.
risks: Price cuts pressuring margin if demand softens post-credit expiration.
Autonomy regulatory hurdles or safety incidents delaying FSD monetization.
Rising competition in China (BYD, Li Auto) and macro sensitivity to rates.

tickers.theme: Leading-edge foundry, advanced packaging (CoWoS, SoIC), AI supply chain enabler.
metrics: Capacity utilization, capex guidance (>USD 32B FY25), gross margin trend (target 53%+), AI revenue mix.
risks: Geopolitical risk in Taiwan Strait, supply chain shocks.
Margin pressure from overseas fabs and customer price negotiations.
Dependency on a handful of mega-customers (AAPL, NVDA, AMD) for leading-node demand.

tickers.core_idea: Solana aims to be the default high-throughput, low-latency settlement layer for *consumer* and *exchange-like* on-chain activity (payments, DEX trading, perps, NFTs, DePIN), while steadily improving resilience (multi-client), validator economics, and institutional access. The bet is that real usage (transactions + active users) and growing validator revenues eventually translate into durable protocol revenues and value accrual to SOL via fee burns, staking yields, and broader capital-market rails (futures/ETFs).
bull_triggers: **Bear:** Reliability stalls, user base shrinks, validator economics weaken.
**Bull:** Firedancer success, CME futures + ETF approval, sustained trading/payment leadership.
risks: **Reliability/outages:** Last major outage Feb 2024; small 2025 disruptions observed.
**Validator concentration/MEV:** Ongoing monitoring needed.
**Regulation:** Futures/ETF path and stablecoin legislation could sway flows.
**Competition:** Ethereum L2s, other L1s compete for devs/liquidity.
